text: (750ml bottle @ Koelschip, Copenhagen, May 11/17) Pours a clear pale copper colour with a small bubbly white head that leaves a ring. Notes of hefty, slightly wood, fortified wine, white grapes, soft pit fruit, a bit oxidized, tannic like weak iced tea, some malt, lightly funky, attic, a bit of lemony zippiness still. Lots of wood and wine barrel into the finish, slightly tart aftertaste. Medium full and oily body with very restrained carbonation. Big barrel character here, a bit sombre in some ways, not a bright fresh gueuze. Quite complex and interesting.

Bottle shared at Akkurat. Hazy golden with a off white head. Aroma is quite fruity at first with peach and apricot followed by a bit of grass, citrus and light barnyard. Light presence of grapes. Taste is peachy upfront with some dry, musky oak, white wine and a light grassy bitterness. Lingering white grape at the back of the tongue. Complex, dry and elegant.

2015 bottle shared at Akkurat. Aroma is grapes, peach, apricots, orange zest. Taste is apricots, a bit spicy, zezty, a touch of cointreau, grape must. High carbonation, oily mouthfeel. Very nice, it has a lot of complexity - doesnt feel too gueuzey, though, at least not in a classic sense.

[5/14/17] Bottle at Koelschip in Copenhagen. Hazy golden with a white head. Wonderful aroma full of barnyard, fruitiness, cobwebs, oak, leather, a bit of white wine, citrus. Sour flavor, juicy, oaky, slightly bitterish finish. Lively carbonation. Really great.

From 750 ml bottle at Koelschip, Copenhagen. Clear golden color with off white head. Yeasty and malty aroma, funky, barnyard, grass, citrusy fruity, some wood. Sweet and acidic taste like aroma. Light thin to oily body, dry, soft carbonation.

Bottle @ Koelschip. Clear amber with medium off-white head. Aroma is malt, fruit, barnyard, lemon and tart. Flavour is malt, fruit, little lemon, medium dry, grapes, white wine, barnyard and a little sweet.
Bottle @ Koelschip, Copenhagen. Light hazy bronze pour with a small head. Notes of funk, citrus, sweet grapes, leather and a lingering tartness.
At koelschip, pours yellow with a small head, aroma of brett, complex with sulfur, tea, fruity, flavor is sour with lemon, acidity, wood, apricot, medium bodied, great
Bottle - Lots of funk, light petroleum and farmhouse notes. Cloudy gold with a decent white head. Nice light acidity, touch of funk and raw oak. Decent.
Pours clear orange yellow with no head. Aroma is funk and barnyard. Taste is mild acidity, zesty, tart green apple, grape ester.
Bottle at mikkeller and friend 2017... Dark copper... Thin tan lacing... Dry barn yard funk nose... Soft fruits.. Long barnyard funk soft dry barn yard funk dry fruit
Bottle @ Koelschip. Hazy golden with a small white head. Aroma is sweet, malty, lemon and barnyard. Flavor is medium sweet and moderate acidic. Dry and moderate acidic finish. 110517

Bottle @ Mikkeller & Friends. Pours dark golden with an offwhite head. Aroma of light sourness, leather, wood, barnyard, tart green fruit, grapes. Flavor is sour, wood, barnyard, grapes, apples. Medium body, average carbonation, dry and acidic finish. Nice and easy. 110517

Bottle @ koelship. Pours hazy golden with a white head. Aroma of funk, barn, wooden, notes if sesam, slight vinegar, slight dust. Taste is quite sour, with sweet notes , malty , grapes, white wine, sweet. Decent

Bottle @ Koelschip. Pours hazy dark orange with a small white head. Aromas of wet forrest floor, mushrooms, sweet vinous notes, nutty, macaroons, peach, orange, light vinegar. Taste is sweet, vinous, light vinegar, subtle grapey acidity, huge orange and tangerine, light bready, lots of oak, pineapple.

Bottle [email protected]/* <![CDATA[ */!function(t,e,r,n,c,a,p){try{t=document.currentScript||function(){for(t=document.getElementsByTagName('script'),e=t.length;e--;)if(t[e].getAttribute('data-cfhash'))return t[e]}();if(t&&(c=t.previousSibling)){p=t.parentNode;if(a=c.getAttribute('data-cfemail')){for(e='',r='0x'+a.substr(0,2)|0,n=2;a.length-n;n+=2)e+='%'+('0'+('0x'+a.substr(n,2)^r).toString(16)).slice(-2);p.replaceChild(document.createTextNode(decodeURIComponent(e)),c)}p.removeChild(t)}}catch(u){}}()/* ]]> */, Copenhagen - Amber pour with thin white head. Aroma and taste is delicate yet complex, lots of muscatel grape, vineous, some light caramelised sweetness, some lemon citrus, some wood, funky tart fruity into the finish. Lovely.
Bottled. A hazy golden beer with a lemons, straw, wood, and brett. The flavor is acidic with notes of lemons, brettanomyces, wood, and sttraw, leading to a tart finish.

Sample @ CBC Boston, 2016. Hazy medium gold pour with a small head. Bright, somewhat cheesy nose. Soft white grape and general citrus. Bucolic. Flavor is zippy, deft. Lightly sour. Oaky funk. A bit of dry manure. Just a hint of unwashed stone fruit. Medium bodied for the style, effervescent carb. Wow, this is good.

Bottle 750ml. corked. [ As Bokkereyder Averell 2015 ].Clear medium orange yellow color with a large, frothy, good lacing, mostly lasting, off-white to white head. Aroma is moderate malty, pale malt, funky, tart, barnyard, leather, manure, sweetmalt, fruity malt, gooseberry - grape skin - grapes, wood - oak. Flavor is moderate to heavy sweet and acidic with a long long duration, funky, tart, gooseberry - grape skin, barnyard, vanilla sweet notes, super dry. Body is medium, texture is oily to watery, carbonation is soft. [20161229]
 9-4-9-4-18

2015 bottle at Koelschip. It pours clear amber with medium white head. The aroma is fresh, sweet, soft, vanilla, icing sugar, pear, apple, sweet white wine, toasted almond, white bread and oak. The taste is crisp, dry, tart, vinous, gooseberry, white grape skin, vanilla, tapioca, oak, toasted almond, mild acidity, greengage, apricot, nectarine, lemon sherbet with a firmly dry finish. Medium body, fine carbonation and foamy, massing carbonation. Great depth and lovely balance. This makes me happy.
75 cl. bottle. Hazy yellow colour with a white head. Aroma and flavour of yeast, fruit, spice, tartness and acidic.
Bottled. Amber coloured. Dense off white head. Aroma. Earth, sourness, barnyeard, fruits. Flavour. Earth, funk leather, barnyard, fruits. Medium to full bodied. Ends. Sour and funky.
75 cl bottle. Pours hazy orange with a small white head. Fruity. Smooth. Peachy and slight citrusy, mellow fruity. Smooth fruity far finish. Dry, mellow and wooden. Dry and citric far finish.

Draught at Koelschip.
Hazy orange colored with a medium sized white head.
Fruity and light acidic aroma of barnyard and white wine.
Fruity and light acidic flavor of barnyard and white wine.
Tart finish.
Bottle at Akkurat. (595 SEK) Hazy golden with a small white head. A bit different but balanced one with grapes, oak, some brett and soil. The finish was sour and dry.
@ Akkurat 16-12-12: riktig god med tydliga toner av vindruvor. Balanserad syrlighet. Fantastisk gott.

Bottle At akkurat. Pours clear darker blonde, ok white head. Smell is funk, sour, oak,bit dry. Taste is full, sour, dry, oak, intense. Funky, complex. A tad more malty than im used to in oude Geuze, not as Sharp either. Still pretty Nice though, and a very good offering from this Young brewery. The carbo is exactly right ( which is one of the hardest things to acomplish in this style of beer, and something thats someone like Pierre tilquin cant seem to get right ) i expect greatness to come from this guy ! This Feels like a step up from the inofficial brews. But not like the best he will be capable of over time. Just that Little extra waaw factor will set bokereyder on the map, never to be vanished or forgotten.

Note based rating. Hope to improve on it in the future:Bottle @ Akkurat. Hazy golden pour with a small white head. Sourdough crackers, hints of caramel, un-popped popcorn, dirty brett and hints of rubber. Sour without getting harsh. Green herbs, thistles and moist soil. Dry with some wooden astringent tannins. Bit weird but nice.

Bottle poured during CBC Boston 2016 from my boy, GOT. Pours a golden body with light haze and soft white, restrained lacing. Mouthfeel is well balanced, not overly acidic, not abrasive and not too dull; rather, notes of aged gouda, oak, soft tannins and nice minerality on the palate.

Bottle at Akkurat Zwanse 2016.
Fairly clear golden, no head.
Lots of barrel in the aroma. Kind of weird mix of lambic with coconut and vanilla with wood lemons and funk.
Taste is citrus like oranges and grapefruit with grapes, wood and a woody dry bitterish finish.
Medium, slight crisp carb, slight oily to bone dry.
Ok. Bit weird.
Bottle - pours gold white head - nose/taste of wine, oak, horsey blanket, lemon funky notes - medium body
From Bottle @ De Prael. Golden color. Oak, lemon and a hint of honey in the aroma, sweetish, soft sour, herbal flavor. Sage, honey, lemon, oak. Soft but Fairly complex.

Sampled from bottle at De Prael Proeflokaal during Carnivale Brettanomyces 2016. Almost clear, golden amber with a white head. Sourish-fruity, quite funky aroma of lemon, rhubarb, gooseberry and oak. Very sour, a bit fruity and moderately funky taste of lemon, rhubarb, gooseberry, barnyard and oak, followed by a medium long, rather tart and dry finish. Medium body, very astringent mouthfeel, average carbonation. Really good!
Bottle. Cloudy golden color, white head. Very dusty aroma with fruit and pepper. Taste is dusty hay, straw, barnyard. Very tasty.
